title: ID: Taxi Driver title font
content:
Can anyone I.D. these two faces from the titles for “Taxi Driver”? Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906193125im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/TaxiTitle1_6238.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906193125im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/TaxiDeNiroTitle2_4971.jpg)

 [‹ WANTED | can anyone id. this font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906193125/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45117 "Go to previous forum topic") ["Classic Grill" connected neon-like script ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906193125/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45065 "Go to next forum topic")
author: anpanman

comments.content:
It’s wonderful and I don’t think it’s been digitized. [Here are my (non-squooshed) snapshots.](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906193125/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/stewf/tags/taxidriver/)

If you’re interested in the shadowed variation you might dig [Cuba](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906193125/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/cubanica/cuba/?refby=typographica). For the rest, have a look at [Unovis](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906193125/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Unovis+OT).
